result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy L Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Timothy L Jackson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Timothy L Jackson was found guilty of 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Timothy L Jackson was found guilty of Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Timothy L Jackson was found guilty of Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program after completes one year of confinement.

superMiscConds.notes: Costs in Count 4 shall be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all prison wages at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision.  If extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with financial obligations owing, a judgment shall be entered.
Defendant shall obtain and maintaint full time employment or schooling or combination thereof to equal full time.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobiriety.  

Defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substance without a valid prescription and then take medication as prescribed.  

Defendant shall provide proof of prescriptions to the probation agent.  

Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons.  

Defendant shall have no contact with any of the victims involved in the offense or with the Washington House located in West Bend.

Defendant shall have no contact with Chavez G. or Danielle S.  

Defendant shall not associate with known drug users or dealers.  

Defendant shall have no contact with any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent and comply with treatment recommendations.

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.

Defendant shall submit to random drug screens.

Defendant shall pay any supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
Defendant shall comply with an AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Defendant eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program after completes one year of confinement.
Consecutive to: Count 2

superMiscConds.notes: All conditions of Extended Supervision contained in Count 2 are inclusive of Count 3.

supervisions.notes: Costs shall be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision in Count 2 and Count 3.

records.addlTxt: Disposition Form
Def appears in custody & w/Atty Craig Mastantuono.  Atty Mark David Bensen for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Agent Karen Held also appears.  Statements by counsel and defendant.  Court enters judgment.
Letter received from Atty Craig Mastantuono with attachments
Presentence Report e-mailed to DA's office & defense counsel
Confidential
Disposition Form
$50,000 cash bond revoked; Defendant held without bond
St Exh #1
Sentencing hearing at 03-21-2016 01:30 pm

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Craig Mastantuono.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Clerk: EZ.  State filed Amended Information reflecting Count 2 of Second Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, Count 3 and Count 4 as charged.  State indicates upon plea to Count 2 as amended and Count 3 and Count 4 as charged the State would agree to dismiss Count 1 outright and states basis for amendment as to Count 2.  State agrees to cap total confinment of 4 years for the 3 counts entering a plea and no cap as to ES and defense free to argue.  Atty. Mastantuono indicates State may revisit confinement if PSI recommendation comes in lower but not required as part of negotiations.   Defendant waives reading of the Amended Information.  WITNESS:  Timothy L. J.   Court grants amendment as to Count 2 in the Amended Information.  Court dismissed Count 1 outright.   No contest plea entered to Count 2 as amended,  Guilty plea entered to Count 3 and Count 4.   Court accepts the pleas and finds def guilty on Count 2 as amended and Count 3 and Count 4 as charged and enters judgment.  Presentence Investigation Report ordered.  Court revokes bond.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing at 01-21-2016 08:30 am

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Craig Mastantuono.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Defendant waives reading of the Information.  Not guilty plea entered to all counts.  Counsel advises continue to exchange discovery and discuss with witnesses and request adjournment for purpose of advising court if will be trial or plea.  Hearing scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Arraignment at 12-04-2015 09:00 am

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Craig Mastantuono.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information.  Arraignment scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant's Motion to Modify Bail

Counsel argues bail motion for lower cash bond, State opposes request and request bail remain as set.  Court denies bail modification.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Counsel may be late for the next appearance.  Hearing scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 09:45 am.
Letter received from Atty Mastantuono
Faxed Complaint to Atty  Mastantuono per request recd 9-18-15
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety; Defendant shall not have contact wtih victim CG or Washington House
Hearing at 10-07-2015 08:15 am

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Alyssa Armbrust for State Public Defenders Office.  Atty Peter John Cannon for State.    Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Defendant is not eligible for SPD representation; Defendant will be retaining counsel; State requests high cash bond; Argument from Defense; Court sets $50,000.00 cash bond;   Preliminary hearing time limits waived. Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights.    Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney and for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 08:15 am.
